questions.question: Which bone forms the posterior part of the hard palate?
questions.explanation: The palatine bone forms the posterior part of the hard palate. The maxilla forms the anterior part of the hard palate, while the palatine bone contributes to the posterior portion.

questions.question: The foramen magnum is located in which bone?
questions.explanation: The foramen magnum is the large opening in the occipital bone through which the spinal cord connects to the brainstem. It is the largest foramen in the skull.

questions.question: Which muscle is responsible for the primary action of shoulder abduction?
questions.explanation: The deltoid muscle is the primary muscle responsible for shoulder abduction. While the supraspinatus initiates abduction, the deltoid takes over as the main abductor of the arm.

questions.question: The biceps brachii muscle has how many heads?
questions.explanation: The biceps brachii muscle has two heads: the long head and the short head. The long head originates from the supraglenoid tubercle, while the short head originates from the coracoid process.

questions.question: Which nerve supplies the diaphragm?
questions.explanation: The phrenic nerve (C3, C4, C5) supplies the diaphragm. This nerve provides both motor innervation for breathing and sensory innervation to the central part of the diaphragm.
